posts.post_content: Free mana is free mana. Even if you run multiple, there are plenty of ways to utilize excess copies in an artifact abundant block (Mirrodin and Scar both). Free artifacts and artifact lands make this rather insane, not to mention going with other 0 cost mana artifacts.

Posted By: Cyberium (9/23/2010 4:49:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Absolutely amazing.  
That's about all there is to say. If you are playing a Mirrodin (Scars or otherwise) and you don't have 3 artifacts at all times you are doing something wrong.  
  
Draw another copy? Just tap for mana and sac the copy in play, and play the new copy and tap it. This works particularly well with Krark Clan Ironworks

Posted By: UltimaCenturion (9/25/2010 11:12:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Wow. This is sooooo freaking broken. And you'll get four of them in your deck until it is banned in all formats and restricted in T1. Lessee. Artifact land, then take your pick: Zuran Orb, Ornithopter, Memnite, Phyrexians, Chrome Mox, Lotus Petal, Mox Diamond.... And it counts itself for the Metalcraft, so you only need 2 other artifacts to get the mana. It will be the most expensive card in the set, hands down. Legendary Status \*is\* the only thing that keeps this from being bro-o-oken.
posts.html:

Posted By: Lord_Gravesmythe (9/26/2010 12:40:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Superb mana acceleration. The flavor and feel of this card are Mox worthy.
  
   
Whether you are playing old Mirrodin or new Mirrodin, this card will always have a home. Metalcraft should be achievable turn 1, and it is almost guaranteed turns 2 and 3.
  
   
Legendary status is necessary because this card would be insanely broken otherwise.
posts.html:
Superb mana acceleration. The flavor and feel of this card are Mox worthy.

Whether you are playing old Mirrodin or new Mirrodin, this card will always have a home. Metalcraft should be achievable turn 1, and it is almost guaranteed turns 2 and 3.

Legendary status is necessary because this card would be insanely broken otherwise.

posts.post_content: If it wasn't for the Legendary supertype, it would have felt as powerful as the other Mox. Imagine, a lucky opening hand: four Mox Opals, a land, a Dark ritual, and your favorite 7 or less CMC card, like, dunno, a [Hunting Pack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunting Pack)? Well, it's still quite possible to use his ability on the very first turn, with an artifact land and some 0 or 1 CMC artifact card.
